Description: Green steatite scarab, pierced lengthwise, with elytra marked and base decorated with an incised representation of a hawk with one wing raised and the other down, standing on a corbel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 111, pl. xli, 51)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.65, p.181, pl.23)
